description: The Japanese Persimmon (Diospyros kaki) is a highly prized and versatile tree that produces an abundance of edible fruit. The fruit is round and orange-red in color, typically ripening in October, and has a smooth and sweet flavor. Persimmon trees are admired for a plethora of reasons, including their beautiful foliage, dense branching, and overall attractiveness. Further, the wood of the tree is incredibly hard and can be used for a variety of purposes, from household items to tool handles. Deer are known to visit Persimmon trees, making them a fantastic addition to any landscape. There's something special about owning a Japanese Persimmon tree that bears delicious fruit each year, making it a worthwhile investment for any home.
